intro: Odontarrhena haradjianii, commonly known as the Haradjian's daisy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, which helps reduce water loss in its native habitat. Odontarrhena haradjianii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
